subject: RE: [junit] does junit.textui.TestRunner.run return a non zero st atus code? ( junit & ant problem)
msgSnippet: hello perry, i m on the junit group mailing list also learning how to use unit.  i m not here providing any help to you but thought it was interesting that we
messageBody:
hello perry,

i'm on the junit group mailing list also learning how to use unit. i'm not
here providing any help to you but thought it was interesting that we have
the same last name (tew)...not very common

jon tew
jontoo@...

-----Original Message-----
From: perry.tew@...
[mailto:perry.tew@...]
Sent: Friday, February 02, 2001 3:50 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] does junit.textui.TestRunner.run return a non zero
status code? ( junit & ant problem)


Hello. I'm learning junit, and I'm working through one of the tutorials
listed on junit.org titled "Incremental development with Ant and JUnit".
The problem I'm having is that when I run ant, my junit reports an error,
but ant reports an overall success. If I add a System.exit(1) to the end of
my main method in my Test program, ant reports a FAILURE. I'm following the
tutorial as it's written, but I can't seem to make ant fail when junit does.
Would someone please look at my build.xml (trimmed), junit code, and my
output and see if I'm making a mistake somewhere?

Thanks for your time,
Perry Tew
mailto:perry.tew@...
678-415-3823


build.xml
=============================================================
<target name="test" depends="build">
<java classname="com.cibavision.asmt.library.test.UserTest"
taskname="junit" fork="true" failonerror="true" >
<classpath>
<pathelement path="${build_base}/" />
</classpath>
</java>
</target>
=============================================================


jnuit code (trimmed)
=============================================================
package com.cibavision.asmt.library.test;

import com.cibavision.asmt.library.User;

import junit.framework.*;
import java.io.*;
import java.util.*;

public class UserTest extends TestCase {

public UserTest( String name ){
super( name );
}

public static void main( String[] args ){
junit.textui.TestRunner.run( UserTest.class );
//System.exit(1);
}

public void testOne() {
assert( false );
}
}
=============================================================
